text:
Co-authored by Laura Martin Updated: April 9, 2019

Explore this Article Creating an Even Base Putting on Your Bronzer Finishing the Look Article Summary Expert Q&A Related Articles References





There are This article was co-authored by Laura Martin . Laura Martin is a Licensed Cosmetologist in Georgia. She has been a hair stylist since 2007 and a cosmetology teacher since 2013.There are 13 references cited in this article, which can be found at the bottom of the page.

Applying bronzer is a great way to add an attractive, natural-looking glow to your face, especially on those days when your skin appears a little dull. Applying bronzer incorrectly, however, can make your face look dirty or orange. Start by creating an even base using foundation and concealer. Then apply, blend, and set your bronzer to make your face glow with a warm radiance.
title: How to Apply Bronzer
